--- title: "Introducing {gtreg}: an R package to produce regulatory tables for clinical research" author: "Shannon Pileggi & Daniel Sjoberg" footer: "[Introducing {gtreg}](https://shannonpileggi.github.io/gtreg-workshop-rinpharma-2022/)" logo: "images/gtreg-logo.png" editor: source format: revealjs: theme: slides.scss transition: fade slide-number: true chalkboard: true execute: echo: true output: asis freeze: auto cache: true --- # Introduction ## Licensing
This work is licensed under a [Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/) (CC BY-SA4.0). ## Instructors ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} **Shannon Pileggi** ![](images/Shannon_circle.png){width="57%"} ``{=html} [pipinghotdata.com](https://www.pipinghotdata.com/) ``{=html} [\@PipingHotData](https://twitter.com/PipingHotData) ``{=html} [github.com/shannonpileggi](https://github.com/shannonpileggi/) ``{=html} [linkedin.com/in/shannon-m-pileggi/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/shannon-m-pileggi/) ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} **Daniel Sjoberg** ![](images/dan-modified.png) ``{=html} [danieldsjoberg.com](https://www.danieldsjoberg.com/) ``{=html} [\@statistishdan](https://twitter.com/statistishdan) ``{=html} [github.com/ddsjoberg](https://github.com/ddsjoberg/) ``{=html} [linkedin.com/in/ddsjoberg/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ddsjoberg/) ::: ::: ## Checklist
``{=html} Install recent R release Current version 4.2.1 ``{=html} Install RStudio I am on version 2022.07.1+554 ``{=html} Install packages ``` r install.packages(c("gtreg", "gtsummary", "tidyverse", "labelled", "usethis")) ``` ``{=html} Ensure you can knit Rmarkdown files ## Schedule | Time | Activity | |:--------------|:-------------------| | 09:00 - 09:50 | Section 1 | | 09:50 - 10:00 | *Break* | | 10:00 - 10:50 | Section 2 | | 10:50 - 11:00 | *Break* | | 11:00 - 12:00 | Section 3 |
Please add any questions to the public Zoom chat. These may be answered in the moment or addressed at the end depending on context. # Overview ## gtreg ::: {.columns .v-center-container} ::: {.column width="40%"} ![](images/gtreg_hex_hires.png) ::: ::: {.column width="60%"}
  [{gtreg}](https://shannonpileggi.github.io/gtreg/) is built on      [{gtsummary}](https://www.danieldsjoberg.com/gtsummary/) is built on        [{gt}](https://gt.rstudio.com/) ::: ::: ## {gtreg} overview ![](images/gtreg_overview.svg) ::: notes image from google slides https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Wf8Wdc28UmtSHqwu3-pYg7ZaW52T5l_hjW0roxyMI1k/edit?u sp=sharing ::: # About adverse events ## Adverse events ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-2_4832e3cfdf3d18d17a64f037e7dfffd0'}
patient_id trt system_organ_class adverse_event grade drug_attribution
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Anaemia 4 Unrelated
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Increased tendency to bruise 5 Unrelated
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Increased tendency to bruise 4 Unlikely
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Thrombocytopenia 1 Probably
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Thrombocytopenia 3 Definite
::: - An adverse event (AE) is a medical issue that occurs during the course of treatment or observation. - AEs are classified according to a [hierarchy](https://www.meddra.org/how-to-use/basics/hierarchy), and we typically report lower level terms within a system organ class. - AEs also record severity / grade and likelihood of attribution to treatment. ## Summary table challenges ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-3_4fdf7e5c48c39b0284ed33f5b8b32336'}
patient_id trt system_organ_class adverse_event grade drug_attribution
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Anaemia 4 Unrelated
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Increased tendency to bruise 5 Unrelated
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Increased tendency to bruise 4 Unlikely
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Thrombocytopenia 1 Probably
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Thrombocytopenia 3 Definite
::: - Subjects experience multiple adverse events. - Not all enrolled subjects experience an adverse event. - The percent of subjects experiencing specific AEs is of interest; typically AEs are counted by maximum grade per event per subject. - Multiple AE tables are often required (treatment emergent AEs, AEs on specific treatment cycles, serious AEs, etc.). ## Counting by maximum grade
::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-4_6d2b6bed6db2b8807c09ffa83c2e2cd0'}
patient_id system_organ_class adverse_event grade
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Anaemia 4
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Increased tendency to bruise 5
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Increased tendency to bruise 4
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Thrombocytopenia 1
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Thrombocytopenia 3
::: ## Counting by maximum grade {transition="fade" visibility="uncounted"}
::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-5_8badd99aa53aae01f30d97505ab523a0'}
Patient ID System Organ Class Adverse Event Grade
Term 1
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Anaemia 4
Term 2
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Increased tendency to bruise 5
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Increased tendency to bruise 4
Term 3
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Thrombocytopenia 1
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Thrombocytopenia 3
::: ## Counting by maximum grade {transition="fade" visibility="uncounted"}
::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-6_c1d023f19f2b7342ff08ab40bb58f486'}
Patient ID System Organ Class Adverse Event Grade
Term 1
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Anaemia 4
Term 2
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Increased tendency to bruise 5
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Increased tendency to bruise 4
Term 3
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Thrombocytopenia 1
ID 1 Blood and lymphatic system disorders Thrombocytopenia 3
::: . . .
Similar logic applies when counting by severity (e.g. mild, moderate, severe) - if stored as a factor, the highest factor level is retained (severe). # First adverse event tables ## Data ::: panel-tabset ### Adverse Events `df_adverse_events` * 10 unique subjects * multiple rows per subject ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-7_62349987eab73ca70095f5214d03e5ca'}
patient_id trt system_organ_class adverse_event grade drug_attribution any_complication grade3_complication
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Anaemia 4 Unrelated TRUE TRUE
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Increased tendency to bruise 5 Unrelated TRUE TRUE
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Increased tendency to bruise 4 Unlikely TRUE TRUE
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Thrombocytopenia 1 Probably TRUE FALSE
ID 1 Drug B Blood and lymphatic system disorders Thrombocytopenia 3 Definite TRUE TRUE
ID 1 Drug B Gastrointestinal disorders Intestinal dilatation 2 Definite TRUE FALSE
::: ### Patients `df_patient_characteristics` * 100 unique subjects * 1 row per subject ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-8_dde6faa6972472e98fbf1e2cba4d33fc'}
patient_id trt age marker status discontinued off_trt_ae
ID 1 Drug B 28 4.807148 Adverse Event Yes Intestinal dilatation
ID 2 Drug B 47 7.714544 Completed Study No NA
ID 3 Drug B 39 6.449793 Completed Study No NA
ID 4 Drug B 45 6.319944 Subject Withdrew Yes NA
ID 5 Drug B 58 5.785283 Physician Decision Yes NA
ID 6 Drug A 42 5.630501 Completed Study No NA
::: ::: ## Variable labels * A variable label is an attribute of a variable in a data frame. * Where applicable, _variable labels_ (not _variable names_) are printed in {gtsummary} and {gtreg} tables. * The example data in {gtreg} comes with variable labels; you can also create your own via [`labelled::set_variable_labels()`](https://larmarange.github.io/labelled/reference/var_label.html). ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-9_48ee504502c67a0a06adbf0527063b99'} ```{.r .cell-code} str(df_patient_characteristics) ``` ::: ![](images/df_patient_characteristics_str_hl.PNG) ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-10_0b00a56fab0b46a82578346cb827d96a'} ```{.r .cell-code} View(df_patient_characteristics) ``` ::: ![](images/df_patient_characterstics.PNG) ::: ::: ## First adverse event tables ![](images/gtreg_overview_first.svg) ## tbl_ae_count() - Count *all* AEs (not by maximum grade). ::: panel-tabset ### Code ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-11_5424eb7650de9558c644d97e031665b8'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_adverse_events |> tbl_ae_count( ae = adverse_event, soc = system_organ_class, by = grade ) ``` ::: ### Table ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-12_f1a49cbbb8a563ce0ce305717521750e'}
Adverse Event 1 2 3 4 5
Blood and lymphatic system disorders 8 6 11 12 13
Anaemia 1 3 3 3
Increased tendency to bruise 2 5 2

Thrombocytopenia 3 3 6 1 5
Gastrointestinal disorders 14 9 7 11 9
Difficult digestion 1 3 1
Intestinal dilatation 3 1 1
Myochosis 1 4 3 2 3
Non-erosive reflux disease 5 4 3
Pancreatic enzyme abnormality 4 4 4 2 1
::: ### Data ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-13_04fa2d1db005855da9e5803a0370027a'}
adverse_event system_organ_class grade

::: ::: ## tbl_ae() - Count AEs per subject by maximum grade. ::: panel-tabset ### Code ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-14_47555e9a7a6ef4034a573a71312348cf'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2,3"} df_adverse_events |> tbl_ae( id = patient_id, ae = adverse_event, soc = system_organ_class, by = grade ) ``` ::: ### Table ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-15_facd2529e4e9dcac8f99ffbcf5ff9d09'}

::: ::: ::: ::: ## tbl_ae_focus() - Count dichotomous AE attributes via `include`. - Supply `id_df` to achieve subject denominator. ::: panel-tabset ### Code ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-25_53b47ac915c38e2771c7574c5adcbb6c'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2,7"} df_adverse_events |> tbl_ae_focus( id = patient_id, id_df = df_patient_characteristics, ae = adverse_event, soc = system_organ_class, include = c(any_complication, grade3_complication) ) ``` ::: ### Table ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-26_5d34fd4018a6bd264c7b94adbce310c0'}

::: ::: ::: ::: ## Exercise 1
**Recommended:** Enter the dedicated RStudio Cloud work space (with packages pre-installed) to complete Exercise 1. It may still be helpful to peek at the [exercises web page](https://shannonpileggi.github.io/gtreg-workshop-rinpharma-2022/exercises.html){target="_blank"} to verify that your tables match the desired output. [Click here to enter R in Pharma RStudio Cloud work space for {gtreg}](https://rstudio.cloud/spaces/299322/join?access_code=Vnp96stsVIDLiEJI7AtHAQ4GB1gsptQgnOGb99_N){target="_blank"}
**Otherwise:** Use your personal computer and follow along the [exercises on the website](https://shannonpileggi.github.io/gtreg-workshop-rinpharma-2022/exercises.html){target="_blank"}. Challenge yourself not to peek at the code solutions until you have completed the exercise. ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
15:00
``` ::: # Modified adverse event tables ## Modified adverse event tables ![](images/gtreg_overview_modified.svg) ## tbl_ae() with add_overall() See [documentation](https://shannonpileggi.github.io/gtreg/reference/add_overall_tbl_ae.html) for more `add_overall()` functionality. ::: panel-tabset ### Code ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/tbl_ae_add_overall_5a01f0e0dd2a2bd9e315209bd8297d97'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2,10,11"} df_adverse_events |> tbl_ae( id = patient_id, id_df = df_patient_characteristics, strata = trt, ae = adverse_event, soc = system_organ_class, by = grade ) |> add_overall(across = 'by') |> bold_labels() ``` ::: ### Table ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-31_45e920e70766194167a6b795dc1c617f'}
Adverse Event Drug A, N = 44 Drug B, N = 56
1 2 3 4 5 Overall 1 2 3 4 5 Overall

::: ::: ::: ::: ## Modifying headers Use `modify_header()` and `modify_spanning_header()` with `all_` column selectors. ![](images/gtreg-modify.gif) ## tbl_ae() with modified headers ::: panel-tabset ### Code ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/tbl_ae_modify_header_839fc2a8e47ad9337485c5c129f79fa4'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="12-17"} df_adverse_events |> tbl_ae( id = patient_id, id_df = df_patient_characteristics, strata = trt, ae = adverse_event, soc = system_organ_class, by = grade ) |> add_overall(across = 'by') |> bold_labels() |> modify_header( all_ae_cols() ~ "**Grade {by}**" ) %>% modify_spanning_header( all_ae_cols(TRUE, TRUE) ~ "**{strata}** \nN = {n}" ) ``` ::: ### Table ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-35_3e608d6b572ff794692f1c8cc3ddb02d'}

``` ::: # Table shells ## Table shells ![](images/gtreg_overview_shell.svg) ## Strategy Table shells can be generated for any `tbl_ae()` and `tbl_reg_summary()` by: 1. Create dummy data or use your own data. 2. Pass the data to your function of choice. 3. Overwrite the statistic(s) shown to a fixed character string by implementing the `style_xxx()` function in the `digits` argument. . . . ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-51_9840922bccd781c2e75777ecd76e0887'} ```{.r .cell-code} style_xxx(8:11) ``` [1] "xx" "xx" "xx" "xx" ```{.r .cell-code} style_xxx(8:11, width = 4, digits = 1) ``` [1] "xx.x" "xx.x" "xx.x" "xx.x" ::: ## Uniform shell for tbl_ae() ::: panel-tabset ### Code ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/tbl_ae_modify_header_shell_40c329a196e489a36f6ecc1a5922d617'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="9,10,14"} df_adverse_events |> tbl_ae( id = patient_id, id_df = df_patient_characteristics, strata = trt, ae = adverse_event, soc = system_organ_class, by = grade, digits = style_xxx, zero_symbol = NULL ) |> bold_labels() |> modify_header(all_ae_cols() ~ "**Grade {by}**") %>% modify_spanning_header(all_ae_cols(TRUE, TRUE) ~ "**{strata}** \nN = xx") ``` ::: ### Table ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-53_13d38e3f2f321baf1613619bd08ff35e'}

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {

      // dispatch for htmlwidgets
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for reveal
    if (window.Reveal) {
      window.Reveal.addEventListener("slidechanged", function(event) {
        fireSlideChanged(event.previousSlide, event.currentSlide);
      });
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
